p: 10. Setting up a sign. This becomes clear when we actually set up a sign. We do this with foresight and purpose and in such a way that the sign is able to always manifest the relevant world of meaning. But above, at SZ 75d, we said that a tool usually “holds itself in” and does not “stand out.” In the present case, however, the sign, as a sign, has to be conspicuous. Conspicuous, yes, and readily accessible—but not as something objectively present.
